instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1990 820-01827-A 19v but missing VBUS on U3200..
threads.message:
Hi Gents!

Water damage A1990, 820-01827-A
[LIST=1]
[*]Stuck at 5v.
[*]Short on PPBUS_G3H. The problem was U7220 (CPU PHASE IC 2) changed the IC.
[*]U3200 outputs: LDO3_3, LDO1_8A
[*]Now I have 20v and stuck on 0.052 AMP, but missing VBUS (U3200) shows 0v...  How is that possible?
[/LIST]
Thanks

threads.title: A1990 820-01827-A 19v but missing VBUS on U3200..
threads.message:
Hopeless project, most likely dead CPU; overvoltage through U7220.

VBUS appears only at one port; depends where you connect the charger.

threads.title: A1990 820-01827-A 19v but missing VBUS on U3200..
threads.message: I see.. ok.. Yes, might be the CPU.... it took ages to change out the U7220... the whole board was bloody hot.. could be when I did the change.. unless it was shorted as you said.. will double-check and revert back. thanks master

threads.title: A1990 820-01827-A 19v but missing VBUS on U3200..
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 73745, member: 682"]
Hopeless project, most likely dead CPU; overvoltage through U7220.

VBUS appears only at one port; depends where you connect the charger.
[/QUOTE]
Yes, CPU badly shorted... after double checking...

Thanks, Master... Case closed!
